org.jsfml.audio

Class SoundRecorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
      • org.jsfml.audio.SoundRecorder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SoundBufferRecorder

    public abstract class SoundRecorder
extends SFMLNativeObject
    Abstract base class for sound recorders, which provide functionality to capture audio data.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected SoundRecorder()
      Constructs a sound recorder.

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable()
        Checks whether audio capturing is available on this system.
        Returns:
        true if audio capturing is available, false otherwise.

      • start

        public final void start(int sampleRate)
        Starts capturing audio data with the specified sample rate.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - the sample rate in samples per second.

      • start

        public final void start()
        Starts capturing audio data with a sample rate of 44,100 Hz.

      • stop

        public final void stop()
        Stops capturing audio data.

      • getSampleRate

        public final int getSampleRate()
        Gets the sample rate that audio is being captured with.
        Returns:
        the audio sample rate in samples per second.

      • onStart

        protected abstract boolean onStart()
        Called when the sound recorder starts recording.

        This method can be implemented by deriving classes to perform any actions necessary before audio recording actually starts.

        Returns:
        true to start recording after this method is done, false to cancel.

      • onProcessSamples

        protected abstract boolean onProcessSamples(short[] samples)
        Called when a new batch of audio samples comes in.

        Implementing classes can then process the captured audio data.

        Note that this method will be called in a separate audio capturing thread.

        Also note that this method is currently hardcoded to be called every 100ms, which might be changed in the future.

        Parameters:
        samples - the 16-bit mono samples that were captured.
        Returns:
        true to continue recording after this method is done, false to stop recording.

      • onStop

        protected abstract void onStop()
        Called when the audio capture has stopped.

        Note that this method will be called in a separate audio capturing thread.
